fields.description:
Git commit messages should be written using the imperative mood.

http://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/\\
https://github.com/git/git/blob/bca181109d6f054d525c71a84963bbdc1f0c40bf/Documentation/SubmittingPatches#L112

When pull requests are merged by BitBucket, the message starts with 'Merged in".

Question on StackOverflow:\\
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30721903/is-merged-in-a-commit-message-created-by-bitbucket-or-git
fields.summary: Merge commit messages should use the imperative mood (BB-16101)
name tar / zip contents based on project name

fields.description: It would be good if we could have a clearer information when a credit card is declined so we don't need to raise a support ticket to knows the reason that our Bitbucket account was downgraded.
fields.summary: Add a clearer message when a Credit card is declined

fields.description:
At minimum I would like to be able to query:

* All issues assigned to me, on any project
* All issues reported by me, on any project
* All the issues I am watching

Would be great to get too:

* All the issues on which I have participated
fields.summary: Provide API access to issues across repositories, using filters

fields.description:
Would would be great if if can create our own dashboard tabs

!542121038-home%20%E2%80%94%20Bitbucket%202016-03-07%2009-58-57.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow add-ons to provide dashboard tabs

fields.description:
Zenodo is a great new project (supported by CERN and the EU) to make code citeable. They already integrate with GitHub, but I would love to make my Bitbucket repositories citeable as well. I'm guessing this will require an effort from both Bitbucket and Zenodo.

https://zenodo.org/
fields.summary: Zenodo integration

fields.description: I'm sorry, I think it wasn't a valid issue...
fields.summary: Invalid issue

fields.description:
The ssh help page (https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/7w0zDQ) only provides a md5 fingerprint.\\
Recent openssh client shows sha256 fingerprint by default and I have to manually use ssh-keyscan / ssh-keygen to verify the md5 fingerprint. Also md5 has been known to be vulnerable.
fields.summary: "Use SSH" page should also provide sha256 fingerprints

fields.description: Would be useful when tracking dependencies - don't need commits, don't need issues or other chatter. Just need to know when a new tag has been created in the repo.
fields.summary: Add ability to watch a repo for tags/releases

fields.description: Impossible to see the issue numbers and thus to select one of them on iPad mini
fields.summary: Bitbucket > wrong layout of list of issues on iPad mini (BB-16102)

fields.description:
The new build status API is great! Thanks so much!

We have a some jenkins machines that build in response to each pull request, including pull requests from forks. I think the current build status API will only allow the build status to be posted if we have write access to the fork that submitted the PR. It would be great if those permissions were not required.

Some folks made comments about this type of feature in BCLOUD-8548, so I'm going to cc them here. Apologies if you're not interested:

@amansilla @dbennett @ngoldbaum
fields.summary: Build status for pull requests submitted from forks

fields.description:
I'm liking the new team/project functionality, with one glaring exception: if one gets a link, or finds one's way, to a project (e.g., [this|https://bitbucket.org/account/user/epa_n2o_project_team/projects/EPAN2o]) one sees an almost-naked list of repositories. That's all a project landing page currently is: a repository list! (Am I missing something?) This is _much_ less information-rich than a repo landing page. So I'd like to enquire about, and advocate for, something to serve a project in the same way that the current overview/README content on a landing page serves a repo. Some options that come to mind, in order (roughly) of increasing preference by me:

# most minimally: display the project description on the project landing page. It might still be editable only via the project>Settings.
# "rich-up" the project description (in addition to showing it on the project landing page). E.g., allow composing/editing it with the same sort of Markdown support as you use for these Issues.
# an all-the-way project README, supporting the same range of markup as a repo README. (Definitely reST :-) Might be difficult, depending on how you've implemented projects.
# a project-designatable "master repo." I suspect this is a strategy OP have adopted, and I certainly have, esp "back in the day" before Bitbucket got Projects: one had a single master repo which pointed to and explained the others. (I'm currently extending this to a Project by having the [Project>Settings|https://bitbucket.org/account/user/epa_n2o_project_team/projects/EPAN2o/settings]>Description point to the landing page for my old master repo ... but until project descriptions are better surfaced, that's kinda pointless.) The ease-of-implementation (for youse guys) advantage I can see (ICBW) for this option is that you could just

* leverage (unchanged) the existing UI to set a repo's landing page (in its Settings).
* add UI to allow the user to designate a master repo (e.g., in the Project>Settings).
* surface the content from the master repo's landing-page on the project's landing page. Perhaps without Edit decorations--user could still be required to do that via the master repo's landing page.
* make the project repo list a separate page accessible from the project landing page (as, e.g., Source, Issues, etc are for a repo's landing page).

Apologies if this is a FAQ, but I saw no good match when searching Bitbucket issues, support, or documentation (or when I did a more general websearch).
fields.summary: project landing page needs overview option

fields.description:
Hi\\
Will be great if I can setup to make the pull request read automatically a file in the repo for the description, for example the CHANGELOG.md file.
fields.summary: automatic pull request description based on file

fields.description:
Bitbucket knows the issues associated with a given pull request as they are displayed on the right.

!447891511-related_issue.png|thumbnail!

However, it appears that the pull request API does not return this information.\\
I was not able to find the linked Jira issues for a pull request. I was also not able to find the linked Jira issues for the commits inside a pull request.

This information would be very useful to us. We'd like to generate test plans for a given pull request based on the issues fixed by the pull request.
fields.summary: Return linked Jira issue information in pull request API

fields.description:
Currently the release tags for a repository are being listed in alphabetical order:\\
0.1.1\\
0.1.10\\
0.1.11\\
0.1.2\\
...\\
0.1.9\\
They should be ordered by their semantic versioning number:\\
0.1.1\\
0.1.2\\
...\\
0.1.9\\
0.1.10\\
0.1.11
fields.summary: The list of tags for a repository should be in SemVer order, not alphabetical order

fields.description:
We currently do not treat PSD files as images, as many browsers will not display PSDs (see: BCLOUD-5476)

It would be nice to have a feature where designers can diff PSD files
fields.summary: Show diffs for PSD files (BB-15859)

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm reporting a weird issue here. I Tried to get an archive from my private repository for some time and nothing is working.

Here is my simplest test with curl :

{code}
#!bash

curl --user username:password -v -X GET https://bitbucket.org/gopextest/kikoolol_repo/get/master.tar.gz -o lol.tar.gz                                  
{code}

I've tested this with my normal account (albinos) and everything is fine. I've copy paste my password into curl command and this copy works to log via bitbucket website. So I don't think the problem comes from that.

The only think different I see with my two accounts is that this account is new and labelled as an Atlassian Account while my other account (albinos) is old and labelled as a Bitbucket account. Do you have any idea why I can use Basic Auth with this account ?

Thanks and kind regards,\\
Albin.
fields.summary: Unable to use basic authentication using API with an Atlassian Account

fields.description:
Bitbucket wiki does not support raw HTML in markdown. So I used {{​}} (known as [ZWSP|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero-width_space]) to work around like [here|http://meta.stackexchange.com/questions/140706/how-do-i-make-part-of-a-word-bold-using-markdown], but it does not work, either.

BTW:

* [The markdown safe mode is deprecated.|http://pythonhosted.org/Markdown/reference.html#safe_mode]
* The link "https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?component=wiki&status=open" in [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/use-a-wiki-221449748.html] is wrong. Please take care about case sensitivity in URL.
fields.summary: How to make inline bold/italic text (within a word) handled properly

fields.description:
Newly-added column sorting headers do not work on iOS Safari

Steps to reproduce:

# view your list of repositories using iOS Safari
# click on Last Updated header (sort last updated)
# click on Repository header (sort alpha)
# note order of repositories

Actual result:

Order does not change. Order remains alphabetical.

Expected result:

Order should change to the expected order as per the header title

Additional notes:

Tested on iOS 8.4 and iOS 6.1 Safari. Both have the problem.

The up/down caret also does not change in the headers when you tap them.
fields.summary: Column sort order buttons do not work on Safari iOS (BB-16103)

fields.description:
The "Find repositories" search filter box does not work on iOS Safari.

Steps to reproduce:

# view your list of repositories on iOS Safari
# type some letters into the search box marked "Find repositories" to narrow down shown repositories
# press Enter to apply search (this used to be automatic until last week)

Actual result:

Note the list of repositories is unchanged. All repositories are shown regardless of filter. Filter box is now cleared.

Expected result:

Repository list should be updated to reflect only repositories containing the search text entered. Filter box should show filtering text used

Other notes:

Tested on iOS 8.4 Safari (fails; bug occurs)\\
Tested on iOS 6.1 Safari (fails; bug occurs)

NOTE: This used to work as recently as perhaps 10 days ago.
fields.summary: Find repository search window does not work on iPad Safari (BB-16104)

fields.description: For development branches and smaller project teams it would be helpful to be able to configure BitBucket AWS CodeDeploy add-on to automatically deploy changes.
fields.summary: Allow BitBucket AWS CodeDeploy add-on to perform automatic updates.

fields.description:
To reproduce:

Create a very long repository name (24-30 characters). Commit / push. When looking at the Recent activity, you'll see the repo name text go outside the boundaries.
fields.summary: Long repository names cause CSS text overflow (BB-15856)

fields.description:
Would be great if the links for each item in the path bar at the top of a page was actually a dropdown, that let you quickly switch between items in the current "folder" or containing folder. Also would be great if they had search fields so you could quickly filter for the file or folder you're looking for

To be clear, this clip has an example of the path I'm talking about at the top. Currently if you want to switch to a different item inside say "Public Issue Tracker" you have to click it, which takes you to a new page, and then you search through the list for the item you want. Instead these could be dropdowns so you can switch directly to what you want.

!776758857-test.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Path bars at top of pages should be dropdowns

fields.description:
The BitBucket AWS CodeDeploy add-on is a great way to deploy a project to AWS, but during testing I have discovered that it always deploys the entire project. For large web-sites this will not be acceptable. Ideally the Deploy to AWS link should differentiate between a "branch" and a "commit" so it can send the entire "branch" or only the changes contained in the "commit".

Without this ability, a single change to a single page on a very large web-site requires all pages, files, images, etc to be updated on all servers.
fields.summary: Allow BitButcket AWS CodeDeploy add-on to send single commit. (BB-15843)

fields.description: I.e. allow for Dashboard Tabs (see attachment)
fields.summary: Add-on integration to Dashboard

fields.description: Please help
fields.summary: Permission Denied <publickey> on Git Bash WIndows 8 system

fields.description: Title says it all... Typing in the field does not trigger any visible response, and when submitted, page refreshes but does nothing other than that.
fields.summary: Repo filter/search form in 'Overview' section is inoperative

fields.description:
When creating a lPR that has many diff's, the diff information is often not shown/loaded.

The current Bitbucket UI does not show "this diff is too big to display, click here to retry" link to allow the user to display the diff for files that cannot render.

Previously the diff view would list all changed files and if the diff view for a particular file didn't render, you could click on the link and jump down to the file and have a "this diff is too big to display, click here to retry" link to allow the user to redisplay the diff.

Right now, clicking on the filename link for files that did not render in the pull request diff view does nothing and the non-rendered files does not even show in the PR page at all.
fields.summary: Diffs load inconsistently when creating a pull request with many diif's. (BB-15841)

fields.description:
Our platform repository is showing it's size at 1.4GB but the actually is around 600MB.

We had this happen once before (see issue BCLOUD-12190) and it ended up being a Bitbucket system-generated log file. Jesse did something to clean up the file.

Can someone look into this and, if it is the same issue, delete the log file again?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Incorrect repo site

fields.description:
If you have no followers, your {{https://bitbucket.org/USERNAME/profile/followers}} page displays an "Invite your friends to Bitbucket" button. If I click it, nothing happens.

Firefox 43 on OSX.
fields.summary: "Invite your friends to Bitbucket" link on followers page is broken (BB-15845)

fields.description: As a user who requires proof of delivery of code by a certain date it would be helpful if Bitbucket would also capture and display the date code was pushed in addition to the Author date already displayed.
fields.summary: Display date code was pushed to repository

fields.description: As a user I'd like to use the API to determine which PRs have merge conflicts.
fields.summary: Expose PR's mergeability through API

fields.description:
When viewing a repo on the Bitbucket,  the "recent activity" list to the right side no longer shows times for the commits on this list. Creating repos seems to be broken on Safari as well.

This can be reproduced on Safari on Mac OS X 10.9.5. The time seems to show on Chrome and Firefox though.

Update: Seems there are some are JS bugs, which are causing JS actions not to work work at all (E.g: PR viewing and merging, repo creation)
fields.summary: Creating repos and PRs no longer works and "Recent activity" feed no longer shows times on Safari on Mac OS X 10.9.5 (BB-15858)

fields.description:
_First of all; sorry if this is a duplicate of an already existing issue – I tried searching the issue tracker but couldn't find anything similar._

When using @ mentions (like @mannew to link to my profile), Bitbucket fails to link to the user profile when the user's "real name" contains non a-z characters (like in Swedish the infamous å, ä and ö characters).
fields.summary: In comments: @-mentions are not linked when real name contains non a-z characters

fields.description: Allow to import existing code from GIT to Mercurial. Now the target repository type is fixed to GIT
fields.summary: Import existing code from GIT to Mercurial

fields.description: When you use the OAuth portal to authenticate, and choose Google, nowhere during the redirection back after successful authentication does it call the "Callback URL" with the token. In fact, it just goes right into the http://bitbucket.org main website! This is a broken OAuth flow. If Google is a second class citizen for login, which it seems to be, why not just get rid of it anyways?
fields.summary: OAuth Authentication via Google Doesn't Call Callback (BB-15849)

fields.description:
When I click 'share' at the top-right of my repo overview, i get a popup where i can search for the user i want to add.

After I type the full name, I get a list a 5 users with the same name, unfortunately the one I'm looking for is not in this top 5 list anymore (they were listed a few days ago), I'm guessing there are now more than 5 users with the same name.

Is the only way to actually add this person to know their actual username or email? Maybe admins should be able to scroll through all options when searching for a user to add.
fields.summary: Unable to add a user to a repo through 'Share' dialog if they have a common name

fields.description:
Since today we get the error below when do a git pull, push, commit (etc):\\
ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

We use ssh://git@altssh.bitbucket.org:443/<accountname>/<reponame>/

We have tried the following:

* created new keys
* eval {{ssh-agent}} && ssh-add <key>.pub
* restarted the machine
* from any other machine we don't have the issue.
* via https it works fine
fields.summary: ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host

It's clear content-type header is wrong (it became utf8 8 bit whereas the previous one was was us-ascii 7 bit. My email is replaced by {{me}}. fields.summary: Broken email diff notification (Base64 main body)

fields.description: could you please cancel import process for the repo : https://bitbucket.org/erhany/ecr_opt_freescale
fields.summary: cancel import

fields.description:
Some of the downloads on the [YaRSS2|https://bitbucket.org/bendikro/deluge-yarss-plugin/downloads] project can not longer be downloaded successfully. This happened in the last few days.

Any files from YaRSS2-1.3.3-py2.6.egg and earlier are successfully downloaded, but any of the newer files (later versions) are downloaded as empty files.
fields.summary: Some project downloads no longer work (saved as empty files)

fields.description: Despite being able to clone the repo (a private repo) and commits being present, the site itself shows "No commits to display."
fields.summary: master and develop branches showing no "No commits to display."

fields.description:
My organization would love to see the cloud version be able to manage the rules for pull requests.

* must have 'n' approved reviews to merge to master
* same rules on web UI, source tree, cmd line

as a business with over 100 developers this is really important
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud pull request rules and master merge rules

fields.description: Add link to header/banner to user's pull requests for convenience.
fields.summary: Add "Pull Requests" link to top navigation
Connect resources bundle conflicts with newer versions of AUI in add-ons. (BB-15846)

fields.description: Tried different combination, but it doesn't look like modifying issues is supported in 2.0 of the REST API.
fields.summary: Cannot modify issue using REST v2.0

fields.description: In lieu of BCLOUD-12425, we would like to be able to add/update/remove issue attachments.
fields.summary: Provide REST access to issue attachments

fields.description: Would be nice to be able to define properties (i.e. metadata, not shown in the edit dialog) for properties (and repositories even) similar to [what is available tor JIRA/Confluence|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/jira/entity-property.html].
fields.summary: Support issues properties for add-ons

fields.description: {{2.0/repositories/main/repo/issues}} query of the [REST API|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/version-2-423626329.html] returns only 20 issues at a time. Would like to be able to indicate how many I'd like (up to 100 would be nice).
fields.summary: Allow for loading more than 20 issues at a time, through the REST API

fields.description:
We are working on a new add-on for issue management in bit bucket. We want to show the repository web-item only in repositories with issues enabled.

So, we need something like a {{has_issues}} [condition|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/concepts/conditions.html].
fields.summary: Allow add-on web items to be shown only if the repository has issues enabled.

fields.description:
I am unable to add comments to issues because there's no empty field at the bottom of open issues and I am logged in.  Clicking the edit link under an issue comment causes absolutely nothing to happen, i.e. nothing on the page reacts to the click.  Clicking the Merged or Declined links at the top of the PR page reloads the page, but it only ever shows the open PRs.  I can work around this by adding "merged/" to the end of the URL.

I updated Safari from 7.1 to 9.0.3 to try and resolve these issues which started happening out of the blue this week (week of 2/26/2016). I cleared website data, reset Safari, installed the latest system update (10.9.5), restarted the computer, trashed the Safari prefs file... My colleague running the same version of Safari on Mac OS 10.11 doesn't have this issue.  Everything works in Firefox...  I get this javascript error:

{code}
#!javascript
TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'i.timing')
(anonymous function)director.js:117
(anonymous function)director.js:146
(anonymous function)director.js:458
(anonymous function)director.js:459
tbootstrap 06f2b74b62d9549d8b4c:50
(anonymous function)repositories-view.js:117
tbootstrap 06f2b74b62d9549d8b4c:50
(anonymous function)repositories-view.js:59
tbootstrap 06f2b74b62d9549d8b4c:50
(anonymous function)app.js:23
tbootstrap 06f2b74b62d9549d8b4c:50
webpackJsonpbootstrap 06f2b74b62d9549d8b4c:21
(anonymous function)app.js:1
{code}

Here's a screen recording showing the PR behavior I'm seeing:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/87939936/BUGS/mergedPRlinknotworking.mov

Here's a screen-cap of what I see at the bottom of open issues:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/87939936/BUGS/nocommentfield.png

Here's what I expect to see (using Firefox):

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/87939936/BUGS/commentfieldinfirefox.png
fields.summary: Unable to add issue comments, edit comments, see merged & declined PRs...

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?status=new&status=open&page=84
# Click one of the Open Status values in there

h3. Expected Results
The URL https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?status=open opens and users can view open issues.

h3. Actual Results
The URL that opens is https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?page=84&status=open

It includes page 84 that the user was in step 1

Since there aren't 84 pages of Issues with the value Open, the user gets a 404 error
fields.summary: Filtering issues in the Issue tracker gives 404 error (BB-15838)
tabulation by tab key support please

fields.description:
I am not able to get all the users' email addresses in my team without having their passwords, when I try GET https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/<myusername>/emails I get my own email address but when I try GET https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/SOMEONEelseUSERNAME/emails and enter my own username and password when asked  I cannot get that someone's email address and I have a message saying "forbidden" ( SOMEONEelseUSERNAME is a member of my team and I have an admin access).\\
I was wondering if I could do that using Oauth, even though I have tried and was not able to, but I might be doing something wrong.

Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks,\\
Best,
fields.summary: Is there a way to get the list of all the users' email addresses in a team account?

fields.description:
Push failed\\
Failed with error: error: unable to read askpass response from 'C:\path\git-askpass-0.bat' error: failed to execute prompt script (exit code 1) fatal: could not read Password for 'https://username@bitbucket.org': No error

getting above error while pushing to the git. Have tried almost all solution available over net.\\
Could anyone suggest what should I do to fix it.
fields.summary: Not able to push to git using android studio

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Get into bitbucket.org (dashboard)
* Filter into a project that has a lot of repositories (at least two pages)
* Filter works fine in page 1
* Now jump into page 2; filter is not working anymore
* If you go back to page 1, you'll notice that the filter isn't working anymore.
fields.summary: Filter with projects in the dashboard does not really work when the list of repositories is more than a page long.

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I have created two repositories under a single team. All those repos are under same project too. I have created ssh key in team settings page.

First repo works fine in server through ssh. But after adding second repository, I can't push or pull through ssh.

response is:\\
conq: repository access denied.\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

Is it not possible to use same ssh key for multiple repos under same team?

Thanks
fields.summary: conq: repository access denied

fields.description:
I'd love to be able to save my dashboard filter as a default setting when I later open the main page again.

The ordering is already persistent. So why not filtering?
fields.summary: Persistent dashboard filter

fields.description: If the image size limit can be increased to at least 5MB that will increase productivity.
fields.summary: Increase max image size in pull request comments

fields.description:
There is some javascript error in Safari and i am not able to see commits in pull requests. Actions like Merge, Approve ... are disabled.

Problem is only in Safari since 25.2.2016
fields.summary: Problem merge, approve, see pull requests commits in Safari

fields.description: When files are deployed via AWS CodeDeploy, they are not symlinked. Including the -y option to the archive command should fix this.
fields.summary: AWS Code Deploy feature (BB-15827)

fields.description: I am using Bitbucket with the SourceTree client, and I authenticate using my gmail account. After upgrading ro SourceTree 1.8.2 I am not able to login. After typing in google login info I SourceTree opens an empty website (URL: https://id.atlassian.com/login/google?application=sourcetree) with the errormessage: "Invalid CSRF token found in form body"
fields.summary: SourceTree Client cannot authenticate using Google account after upgrading to 1.8.2

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When writing a comment, the cancellation of the insertion of a code block fails to actually cancel that action.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Begin to add a comment
# In the formatting bar, click the 'Code' button
# Click 'Cancel'
# Notice the code block is still inserted in the comment

h3. Affects
OS X 10.11.2 (15C50)\\
Safari 9.0.2 (11601.3.9)
fields.summary: Cancelling the insertion of a code block still performs the insert in Safari. (BB-15855)

fields.description:
The process just hangs in there and never ends...\\
Problem only with one project.
fields.summary: Bitbucket hangs while merging branches

fields.description:
When I try to push over HTTP protocol (not my choice, issues with SSH), I enter my password and the push breaks on a 502 error, bad gateway. This is probably due to timeout issues, so if you could resolve this it would be appreciated. Thanks.

NOTE: It may have something to do with being behind a proxy, also not my choice.
fields.summary: Bitbucket push over HTTP protocol breaks on 502 error

fields.description:
I deleted a member from my projects, so we have 4 members in each now. But I can not add 5th member to repositories. When I added 5th member, your site warned with the message "t's time to upgrade!\\
Your account needs space for 6 users to complete this action, but you are currently on the 5 user plan.\\
View the users who have access."\\
Please check it and give me an advice for this case.\\
Thank you,
fields.summary: Don't allow to add 5-th member to repository

fields.description:
When a user pushed a tag without pushing the commit itself, the commit will still be pushed to Bitbucket, and will still appear in Bitbucket via specific commit URL or the "All branches" tab, but does not appear on any specific branch's history.

Should be related to this bug: BCLOUD-12294

{code}
Steps to reproduce:
git clone git@bitbucket.org:mcastellini/possible_bug.git
cd possible_bug
echo "First Contributor" >> contributors.txt
git add contributors.txt
git commit -m 'First commit'
git push -u origin master
cd ..
git clone git@bitbucket.org:mcastellini/possible_bug.git possible_bug_other
cd possible_bug_other
echo "Second Contributor" >> contributors.txt
git commit -am "Second commit"
git tag dangling
git push origin --tags
cd ../possible_bug
echo "Third Contributor" >> contributors.txt
git commit -am 'Third commit'
git push origin master
{code}

Note:

* "/commits/branch/master" consistently shows the correct status of master.
* "/commits/all" ends up showing commits that do not belong to any branch, even though they are referenced by a tag; this might be confusing, but it is consistent with the output of {{git --log --oneline --graph --decorate --all}} on origin.
* "commits/dangling" shows the commit as belonging to master which at no point in time is true from the point of view of origin; if you were to run a git {{branch --contains dangling}} on origin you will get no output, meaning that it does not belong to any branch. This is IMHO the actual bug.
fields.summary: When a user pushed a tag without pushing the commit itself, the commit will still be pushed to Bitbucket, and will still appear in Bitbucket. (BB-15854)

fields.description:
Each pull request is mostly a combination of a few commits. In the pull request, we (as a code reviewer) are able to see all the changes of all the commits in one *big* place - which makes the scope of the code review too large for a code reviewer.

A much better idea would be to view the code differences of each commit in a pull-request in a commit-by-commit manner, instead of viewing the code differences of all commits of a pull request together in one page.

The lacking of being able to read through a pull-request in a commit-by-commit approach can cause users to slow down in their team's progress because making code reviews in Bitbucket can be tough when all is in a page.
fields.summary: Feature request: to read through a pull-request in a commit-by-commit approach; rather than all-in-one-big-page approach

fields.description:
Currently the project view has wide open empty space, consisting of just the list of repository names.

The description, or a portion of it, could be included in a column to the right of the repository names to give users an additional information point to reference when looking for a particular repository.
fields.summary: Show repository descriptions in Project view

fields.description:
Hi,

I've been trying to set up SSH access as my old key broke (after a weekend of lying dormant), and after giving in I tried using HTTP protocol, and the server then returned a 502 after trying to push some changes.
fields.summary: HTTP push results in 502 (Bad Gateway)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, a team administrator has to manage permissions for every team repository separately, and this can be time consuming. There is no way to apply permissions for a group of repositories together that belong in the same project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a way to manage permissions for the repositories in a project on a project-level.
fields.summary: As a Team Admin I want to manage permissions for the repositories in a project in an aggregated way

fields.description: It's best if there's a way restrict the users that can trigger AWS CodeDeploy to a specific group as it seems like it is an important security measure to prevent unplanned deployments to a production site.
fields.summary: Restrict the users that can trigger AWS CodeDeploy to a specific group

fields.description:
Hi,

The recently added fiasco projects feature is inconsistent:

* mandatory projects under team accounts
* no projects allowed for personal accounts' repos

This seems bizarre and at the very least inconsistent.

Many users either have a notion of a project per repo or project per team. Conversely, a project may span across teams and repos. This is includes repos under individual accounts. Why do you force us to have a project for team accounts but not allow for projects under individual accounts?

Therefore, the projects feature is otherwise redundant and should be optional for those wishing to use it, especially you don't have it for individual accounts -- it means it must be possible for team accounts to disable it as well. It should really be an optional feature available to both account types!
fields.summary: Projects feature should be optional for both team and personal accounts

fields.description:
Currently we have this info in the website if you do a diff between branches, tags, commits, etc. ( https://bitbucket.org/USER/REPO/branches/compare/1_COMMIT%0D2_COMMIT#pull-requests ) but it's not available in the API.

This would greatly help in automating the generation of release notes based on the PRs that have been merged between builds.
fields.summary: Add API that can return the list of PRs merged between two tags, branches, commits, etc.

fields.description:
I have 2 repos that failed to import, can someone please delete the repos so I can import them using another method?

https://bitbucket.org/sencloudx/lending-cloud-web

https://bitbucket.org/sencloudx/eshop_v4
fields.summary: Repository failed to import, job hung
Project slug case not consistent with repo slug case (BB-15850)
Create a better error message for those logging in with secondary e-mail (Google login) (BB-15815)

fields.description:
Since a lot of sites force really disturbing/painfull fonts incl. modifications of it, a lot of  developers do not "Allow pages to choose their own fonts,..." (e.g. Firefox: Preferences|Content|Fonts&Colors|Advanced). Unfortunately there is no way to exclude some fonts and thus Bitbucket/Atlassian pages look bad/it is hard to find the right button there, because they just show the "unknown letter" or chinese like symbol.

So to make customers happy Atlassian should stop using its home made fonts and use svg for icons which are not part of UTF-8, e.g. like github does.
fields.summary: Stop using Atlassian home made fonts

fields.description:
Files attached to a ticket in the repo's issue tracker become unavailable after the change of repository ownership due to wrong url. Link to the attached file continues to contain the username of the original owner of the repository.

To workaround this, one must manually change the address in the browser to finally get the file, or reattach the file to the tracker manually.
fields.summary: Files attached on issues tracker becomes inaccessible after transferring a repo to another user (BB-15814)

fields.description: It would be much easier to navigate in wiki page if there is navigation bar (maybe a folder view) for me to access each page/chapters on the wiki doc.
fields.summary: Enhancement Request: Easier navigation in wiki by having a navigation bar to access each page/chapters.

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Open a bitbucket repository with issue tracing
# Create at least two issues and resolve one of them, so you have both resolved and open issues
# Click on Advanced Search
# Remove all filters
# Add filter "Status IS Resolved"
# Press the Search button
# Press Advanced Search again
# ==> Filter have now changed to "Reported by IS Resolved"
# Press Search again
# ==> Issues are now filtered by something impossible

----
The parameter that appears at the subsequent Advance Search page is wrong.

The bug makes it hard to make a good filter for issues when it is always changing. This causes the Advanced Search feature for Bitbucket Issues to not\\
work very well.
fields.summary: Subsequent searches in the Advanced Search filter in Bitbucket Issues shouldn't be defaulted to "Reported by ..." with unrelated parameter from the previous search.

fields.description:
There is a bitbucket bug where in a PR if you go to write a comment and @ someone the text cursor moves to the beginning of text input.

*Specs:*

# Chrome 48.0 on OSX 10.11.3

*Steps to recreate:*

# Inside of PR page click on a line of code. type something and @ someone.
# Move to top of the page in the commits area outside of code area and type something and @ someone
# Move back to the line of code with comment and type something and @ someone

Outcome: As you type after @ it will keep jumping back to beginning of text input.
fields.summary: When you @ someone in a PR the text cursor move the beginning of the text input. (BB-15851)

fields.description:
Comments made on the diff shown in a Pull Request's Overview tab are visible in the PR's Activity tab.

However, for complex PRs it is more convenient to use the PR's Commits tab to open each commit individually and leave comments at the commit-level.

It is good that the PR's Commits tab shows an icon summarising the presence of comments or an approval per individual commit. It would be even better if the commit-level comments were also displayed in the timeline of the PR's Activity tab.
fields.summary: Display commit-level comments on Pull Request Activity tab

fields.description: Why users with Admin rights have permission to transfer repository ownership? Should not this permission be available for repository Owner only?
fields.summary: Admins have permission for repository ownership transfer. Why?
error: RPC failed; result=52, HTTP code = 100

fields.description: When we try to mention someone in a private repo the search box shows unknown users which don't have permissions in that repo.
fields.summary: non-members of private repo being selected by @ calls (BB-15805)

fields.description: Bitbucket does not support multiple Google logins (personal and work), yet the user interface doesn't indicate that. The system should be improved to either allow multiple associations or report back that the account is a associated with another Google login.
fields.summary: User Interface should indicate that Bitbucket does not allow multiple Google logins.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create new Bitbucket project and save settings.
# Select Projects from top menu, navigate to another (existing) project.
# Select Projects from top menu, navigate back to the newly created project.
# Edit the project settings and change the Key.
# Save the new Key setting for the project.
# Repeat step 2.
# Repeat step 3.
# 404 error.
fields.summary: Changing Project key, and then navigating it via the top menu leads to a 404. (BB-15806)

fields.description:
Reviewing pull requests that two or more changes have been made in a single file, some times, is not that simple. Even more when those changes aim the same section of code.

So, if each modified file in the pull request interface could have their related commits grouped in a (header or footer) section next to them, the reviewing task could become easier, considering that the reviewer could fetch the related commits for the evaluated file such that he/she could better understand the code "evolution".
fields.summary: Group commits for each modified file in the pull request interface

fields.description: If you attempt to access a public project, you have to login with a valid user.  However, public repositories are viewable by anyone regardless of having a Bitbucket account.
fields.summary: Public projects require a Bitbucket account in order to be accessed. (BB-15792)

fields.description:
Hi, I am trying to access api 1.0 for Forking a repo and it seems to be working fine but is inconsistent. It suddenly stops working and returns as SERVICE UNAVAILABLE.\\
Is there any workaround for this?

Also I am trying to use api 1.0 for creating a new repo and it works fine. However if I use 2.0, it says INTERNAL SERVER ERROR.

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/username/newreponame

Could anyone please address these issues?
fields.summary: Why bitbucket api 2.0 doesn't support Fork.?

Instead of

*After*\\
[!671695180-000220.png|thumbnail!|https://bitbucket.org/repo/LboRq/images/671695180-000220.png]

fields.description:
Hi, I posted this in Atlassian Support as well, but it's not really clear to me which area is the appropriate place to post this, so I apologize if this is the wrong place. I am able to find other posts about this same issue here, but it always results in someone at bitbucket fixing the problem on their end so I'm not really sure how to fix it.

When pushing my commits to my repo, I get an error. Here is the exact error: "HTTP Error: 500 (Internal Server Error)". I am using TortoiseHG.

I am able to push to other repositories on bitbucket, so it can't be that bitbucket is down. Most threads I can find about the problem just show someone from Bitbucket solving the problem on their end. Is there a way for me to solve the problem?

More background: this is a repository that I have been pushing to regularly for a bit now. Recently I installed HG-Git for a separate project. I attached the extension in TortoiseHG correctly, then decided to use SourceTree instead for that project. I came back to this project and HG-Git was causing problems. I turned off the HG-Git extension in TortoiseHG settings and uninstalled HG-Git. And now instead of HG-Git errors, it's giving me the error written above. It seems unlikely that SourceTree has anything to do with the problem but HG-Git and SourceTree are the only things I can think of that are different since this started happening.

I also updated to the latest version of TortoiseHG, but that didn't help.
fields.summary: HTTP Error: 500 (Internal Server Error) when pushing

fields.description:
We add links to our tickets or git sometimes from site competitors, blogs, or other examples from other sites, but to be honest we don't really like it if they knows/can see our tickets address (source) or git push address. So far we use http://hideref.org/ to hide the origin.

Perhaps it's an idea to make a redirect service for all links that are used? To make your service more secure?
fields.summary: Don't send referrer for link in user content

fields.description: I deleted a remote repository branch in bitbucket. However, on running "git branch -r", the remote branch is still listed. Someone care to fix this?
fields.summary: Remote repository branches bug

fields.description:
Have a special read-only URL that users can specifiy in the .gitmodules file to avoid users trying to make changes from within the submodule.

Perhaps we can have an equivalent for Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Make a submodule read-only in Bitbucket

fields.description: e.g. If I go to https://bitbucket.org/Foo/bar/pull-requests/new?source=wibble yet the actual account name is "foo", I will be redirected to https://bitbucket.org/foo/bar/pull-requests/new with the request parameter stripped, meaning my intention to create a PR from a certain branch is discarded, and in fact the user sometimes doesn't notice this happened and creates a PR from the wrong branch
fields.summary: pull-requests/new with wrong capitalisation of account name redirects and discards requests params (BB-15777)
